titles.title: Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael (fols. 2ra-87rb) I-1) Homily by Timothy (Dämatiwos), Patriarch of Alexandria for the 12th of Ḫǝdar (fols. 2ra-7va); miracle (fols. 7va-8vb); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 8vb) I-2) Homily by an anonymous author for Taḫśaś (fols. 8vb-14ra); miracle (fol. 14ra-vb); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 14vb) I-3) Homily [by Epiphanius, Metropolitan of Cyprus] for Ṭǝrr (fols. 14vb-24vb); miracle (fols. 24vb-25va); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 25va) I-4) Homily by an anonymous author for Yäkkatit (fols. 25va-28va); miracle (fols. 28va-29va); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 29va) I-5) Homily by [Severus] Patriarch of Antiochia for the 12th of Mäggabit (fols. 29va-45va); miracle (fols. 45va-46va); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 46va-vb) I-6) Homily [by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs the Orthodox] for Miyazya (fols. 46vb-50vb); miracle (fols. 50vb-52va); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 52va-vb) I-7) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, ʾeṗṗisqoṗos [Metropolitan] of Ethiopia for Gǝnbot (fols. 52vb-54rb); miracle (fols. 54rb-55vb); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 55vb) I-8) Homily by [Yoḥannǝs,] Metropolitan of ʾAksum (ʾAkusǝm) [for Säne] (fols. 55vb-63vb); miracle (fols. 63vb-64vb); ʿarke-hymn (fols. 64vb-65ra) I-9) Homily [by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs] for Ḥamle (fols. 65ra-69ra); miracle (fol. 69ra-vb); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 69vb) I-10) Homily by an anonymous author for Näḥase (fols. 69vb-72va); miracle (fols. 72va-73rb); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 73rb-va) I-11) Homily by an anonymous author for Mäskäräm (fols. 73va-76ra); miracle (fols. 76ra-78ra); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 78ra) I-12) Homily by an anonymous author for Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 78rb-81va); miracle (fols. 81va-87ra); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 87ra-rb)
Additiones 1-2.

originlink.xlink:title: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

locationlink.xlink:title: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased throughout the Ms. and replaced with the names of “the servants” Ḫaylä Täklä Haymanot, Gädlä Mikaʾel and Surahe Krǝstos (e.g., fols. 23va, 55vb; the name of Surahe Krǝstos was sometimes written in an unusual way, e.g., fols. 14ra, 51ra, 56ra) and of “the maids” Fǝqǝrtä Täklä Haymanot and ʿƎśśetä Täklä Haymanot (e.g., fols. 25va, 52vb, 73va, 88rb). Then again, the name of Surahe Krǝstos has been often erased (e.g., fols. 8vb, 24vb, 45rb, 46vb, 51ra). According to Additio 2, the Ms. was some when donated by Täsfa Mikaʾel to the church.

dcomments.dcomment: 19th cent. (?) The miniatures might originate from an older codex (17th-18th cent.?).

txstates.txstate: The Ms was resewn with modern synthetic threads. 1/3 of the front board is cut off. The leather cover is detached from the back board and completely torn off from the front board and spine; traces of leather are visible on the outer side of the front board. Some folios are stained with dirt (fols. 19v, 20r, 27v, 28r). Fol. 49 is cut at the bottom.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark-brown tooled leather (partly missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration:
Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover is poorly visible (7 tools were used: triple line fillet, interlaced dot fillet, double circle, corni-form, small x, wave form with dots, cross hatching).
The inner side of both boards is decorated with paintings on cloth. It is unclear whether both boards with the painting were produced for this codex or they are reused parts of an icon.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
A(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fols. 1r-v) – I(8/fols. 2r-9v) – ፪II(10/fols. 10r-19v) – [፫]III(8/fols. 20r-27v) – [፬]IV(6/fols. 28r-33v) – V(2/fols. 34r-37v) – ፭VI(8/fols. 38r-45v) – ፮VII(8/fols. 46r-53v) – ፯VIII(10/fols. 54r-63v) – [፰]IX(8/fols. 64r-71v) – ፱X(8/fols. 72r-79v) – [፲]XI(8/fols. 80r-87v) – XII(2/fols. 88r-91v) – XIII(10/fols. 92r-101v).
One bifolio with miniatures (fols. 15-16) has been sewn into in quire II, between fols. 14 and 17. One bifolio with miniatures (fols. 82-83) has been loosely (?) inserted into quire XI, between fols. 81 and 84; another two bifolios (fols. 95-98) in quire XIII, between fols. 94 and 99.

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Some leaves have one (fols. 54rv, 63r), some two (fols. 57rv, 60rv) additional bottom ruled line not used by the scribe. Fol. 45r has an additional crudely ruled line at the bottom, close to the edge of the folio.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist and of the angel Gäbrǝʾel (fols. 20vb, 21va, 68vb, 76ra, 81rb); names of the donors (erased and replaced); elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I (alternating with black lines), two initial lines in the incipit of sections (homilies) and of subsections (miracles); the first word in the incipit of subsections (hymns), i.e. sälam "salutation".

additional.det: The note is very crudely written beneath Additio 1 and repeated on fol. 101v. It states that Täsfa Mikaʾel donated the Ms. to the church of St. Michael. Other persons, such as Wälättä Ṣadǝqan, are also mentioned.

extras.extra: - Erased notes in the bottom margin of fol. 52vb. - Erased notes on fol. 87rb, partly overwritten with a short supplication for the “maids” Fǝqǝrtä Täklä Haymanot and ʿƎśśetä Haymanot, in red. - Tämälläs-signs indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margins (fols. 3ra, 3vb, 6va, 8rb, 10ra, 20rb, 23vb, 28va, 32ra, 35rb, 35vb, 36rb, 37vb, 42rb, 44ra, 46ra, 48vb, 49rb, 49va, 56rb, 64ra, 65vb, 66va, 69va, 70rb, 74rb), belong. - Many corrections written in a secondary hand over erasures: e.g., fols. 2rb, 2va, 3vb-5rb, 6va (several lines), 9va, 10ra-11va, 17ra, 20rb, 23va, 27v, 34vb, 37r, 45r, 46va, 49vb-50va, 51v, 52vb (incipit of a section), 53rb, 55vb (incipit of a section), 66va-68rb, 75r, 78rb (incipit of a section), 86ra. - Erasures are marked with thin lines: e.g., fols. 3rb, 4ra, 4vb, 10rb, 20rb, 24rb, 41va, 66ra. - Erasures without marking: e.g., fols.6ra, 22va, 50vb, 66ra. - Omitted letters and words sometimes inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 7rb, 25vb, 27va, 50ra, 68rb, 75rb, 76va, 80rb, 86rb.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks (partly faded) are written in the left upper corner in fols. 10r: ፪(?); 38r: ፭, 46r: ፮(?); 54r: ፯; 72r: ፱.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Coloured threads inserted into fols. 69 and 73. - Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margin, in red: ዘኅዳር: fol. 2ra ዘታኅሣሥ: fol. 8vb ዘጥር: fol. 14vb ዘየካቲት: fol. 25va ዘመጋቢት: fol. 29vb ሚያዝያ: fol. 46vb ዘግንቦት: fol. 52vb ዘሰኔ: fol. 55vb ዘሐምሌ: fol. 65ra (above an erased indication) ዘነሐሴ: fol. 69vb መስከረም: fol. 73va ዘጥቅምት: fol. 78rb.

miniature.info: Front board, inner side: Percussio capitis.
miniature.details: Painted on cloth. Partly missing.

miniature.info: Back board, inner side: Crucifixion.
miniature.details: Painted on cloth.

miniature.info: Fol. 1r: Nativity.
miniature.details: The unfinished miniature shows European features. It is difficult to determine whether it was painted by an European artist or by an Ethiopian artist copying an European example. The unruled leaf has been inserted upside side down.

miniature.info: Fol. 1v: A man and a woman, a tree between them.
miniature.details: Legend: ኵርአተ፡ እርእሱ፡ Kwǝrʿatä rǝʾǝsu “Striking of his Head”. A crude hand added: ኵርአቶ፡ ለኢየሱስ “Striking of Jesus”. Unfinished miniature by the same artist as miniature 3. The unruled leaf has been inserted upside side down.

miniature.info: Fol. 15r: A holy woman sitting, several human figures behind her; a man standing in front of them.
miniature.details: Unfinished, painted probably by the same artist as miniature 3.

miniature.info: Fol. 15v, above: A man and a woman, talking to each other. Fol. 15v, below: A king on a white horse, flanked by Archangel Michael and a man.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniature 7) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael, probably the story with the poor Däratawos who wants to prepare a feast for Archangel Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green background.

miniature.info: Fol. 16r, above: A man standing beside people eating at a table. Fol. 16r, below: Three human figures with a ram.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniature 6) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael, probably the story with the poor Däratawos who wants to prepare a feast for Archangel Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green/red background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 16v: A woman and a man sitting, below the holy woman talks to two men.
miniature.details: Unfinished, painted probably by the same artist as miniature 3.

miniature.info: Fol. 30r, above: A praying man standing in front of a church, Archangel Michael descending.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniatures 10-12) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 30v, above: Two men talking in front of a church. Fol. 30v, below: The rich man weighing his gold (?).
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniatures 9, 11-12) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with green and yellow background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 31r, above: The rich man sitting, beside a fish eating a wooden box. Fol. 31r, below: A man pulling out the fish with a net.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniatures 9-10, 12) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow background.

miniature.info: Fol. 31v, above: Two men, a wooden box between them Fol. 31v, below: Two men, one handing money to the other, a church behind them.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniatures 9-11) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 58r: A man lying on a bed, below a praying woman.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniatures 14-15) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow/red and green background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 58v, above: A woman sitting. Fol. 58v, below: Two human figures with tools in hell (?).
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniatures 13 and 14) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow/red and green background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 59r, above: St. Michael fighting against the devil. Fol. 59r, below: A human figure (woman?) and two demons in human disguise.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniatures 13-14) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow/red and green background.

miniature.info: Fol. 82r: Priests celebrating the liturgy, two human figures in front of the church (one sleeping, one begging).
miniature.details: This miniature represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael (?). Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and red background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 82v: A man in a boat in the sea.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniature 18) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 83r: Several men in a boat in the sea.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniature 17) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf.

miniature.info: Fol. 83v: Baptism of several men.
miniature.details: This miniature represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael (?) Painted on unruled leaf with yellow background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 84r: Nativity.
miniature.details: Painted on unruled leaf with yellow/red and green background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 84v, above: Two human figures discussing. Fol. 84v, below: A human figure with a box at the sea.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniatures 22-23) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with green and yellow background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 85r, above: Several persons discussing. Fol. 85r, below: A man holding a letter in his hand and receiving instructions from another person, two black people behind them.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniatures 21 and 23) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green background.

miniature.info: Fol. 85v, above: St. Michael on a white horse meeting the man with the letter. Fol. 85v, below: The man reading the letter to the community, behind him two black people.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniatures 21-22) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with green and yellow background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 87v: Jesus, a prone figure below (donor?).
miniature.details: Unfinished, painted on unruled leaf by the same artist as miniature 3.

miniature.info: Fol. 88r: The child Jesus holding a dove, St. Mary and Joseph.
miniature.details: Legend, written in the same secondary hand that inserted the personal names into supplications (see “donor”): ምስለ፡ አእማቲሁ፡ ፍቅርት፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ዕሤተ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ “With the maids Fǝqǝrtä Täklä Haymanot and ʿƎśśetä Täklä Haymanot.” Unfinished, painted on unruled leaf by the same artist as miniature 3.

miniature.info: Fol. 88v: Percussio capitis. a prone figure below (donor?).
miniature.details: Legend, written in the same secondary hand that inserted the personal names into supplications (see “donor”): Surahe Krǝstos. Painted on unruled leaf. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 89v: A large box (a coffin?) in the sea.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniature 28) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf.

miniature.info: Fol. 90r: The devil taking out a human body from the box.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniature 27) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 91r: Archangel Michael, other angels behind him.
miniature.details: Painted on unruled leaf. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 91v: A holy woman with an angel.
miniature.details: Unfinished, painted on unruled leaf by the same artist as miniature 3.

miniature.info: Fol. 92r: St. Mary ? with two human figures.
miniature.details: Painted on unruled leaf with green background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 93r: The Virgin and Child, a prone figure below (donor?).
miniature.details: Painted on unruled leaf. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 94r: The Last Judgement (?).
miniature.details: Painted on unruled leaf with yellow background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 95v, above: A king giving order to his servant. Fol. 95v, below: Two people, a snake in front of them.
miniature.details: This miniature represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael (?) Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green background.

miniature.info: Fol. 96v, above: A man sitting in a chair discussing with two others. Fol. 96v, below: Two people carrying a dead(?) body.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniature 36) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 97r: A man giving order to solders.
miniature.details: This miniature (together with miniature 35) represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green background.

miniature.info: Fol. 98r: A king on a white horse drowning into the sea together with his soldiers.
miniature.details: This miniature represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael. Painted on unruled leaf. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 98v, above: Priests with sistra. Fol. 98v, below: Congregation with musical instruments.
miniature.details: This miniature represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael (?) Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 99v: St. George slaying the dragon.
miniature.details: Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green background.

miniature.info: Fol. 101r: Two horsemen (barely clothed) and a noble man, a face in a cloud.
miniature.details: This miniature represents a court scene of a miracle of St. Michael (?) Painted on unruled leaf with yellow and green background. The miniature is protected with a textile curtain.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r (incipit page Text I): coloured (red, black) ornamental band; anthropomorphic and geometric motifs, crosses.
